{{Short description|American singer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2022}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Danny Gokey | image = DannyGokeyLifest2019.jpg | caption = Gokey performing at [[Lifest]] in 2019 | image_size = | birth_name = Daniel Jay Gokey | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1980|4|24}} | origin = [[Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], {{nowrap|United States}} | spouse = {{Unbulleted list | {{marriage|Sophia Martinez|2004|2008|reason=d.}} | {{marriage|Leyicet Peralta|2012}} }} | genre = {{Hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[Contemporary Christian music|CCM]]|[[blue-eyed soul]]}} | instrument = Vocals | occupation = {{Hlist|Singer|songwriter}} | discography = [[Danny Gokey discography]] | label = {{Hlist|[[19 Recordings]]|[[RCA Records Nashville]]|[[BMG Rights Management]]}} | years_active = 2008–present | website = {{URL|dannygokey.com}} }} '''Daniel Jay Gokey''' (born April 24, 1980) is an American singer and former church music director. He was the third-place finalist on the [[American Idol season 8|eighth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]''.{{cite web |date=February 18, 2009 |title=Danny Gokey: 'Idol's' New 'Hero' |url=http://extratv.com/2009/02/18/danny-gokey-idols-new-hero/ |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=Extra}}[http://www.americanidol.com/videos/season_8/danny_gokey/introducing_danny_gokey "Introducing Danny Gokey: Get to know Hollywood Hopeful Danny Gokey."] American Idol. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110523043125/http://www.americanidol.com/videos/season_8/danny_gokey/introducing_danny_gokey|date=May 23, 2011}}. Retrieved January 18, 2022. After his placing on the show, Gokey signed to [[19 Recordings]] and [[RCA Records Nashville|RCA Nashville]] at the beginning of a career in [[country music]], releasing the [[single (music)|single]] "[[My Best Days Are Ahead of Me]]." His debut album, ''[[My Best Days]]'', was released in March 2010. After leaving RCA Nashville in November 2011, he gravitated his music towards an adult pop/contemporary Christian sound and subsequently made a record deal with [[BMG Rights Management]] in May 2013. He released his second studio album, ''[[Hope in Front of Me]]'', in 2014. ==Early life== Gokey started singing with his family in church, but stated he would rather record mainstream music than perform solely Christian/gospel music. He was the worship director at his church in Milwaukee, Faith Builders International Ministries, for several years.[http://www.wnct.com/nct/lifestyles/faith_values/article/american_idol_finalists_are_church_worship_leaders/32095/ "American Idol finalists are church worship leaders"] Associated Press via WNCT, February 20, 2009. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090421002658/http://www.wnct.com/nct/lifestyles/faith_values/article/american_idol_finalists_are_church_worship_leaders/32095/|date=April 21, 2009}}. Retrieved January 18, 2022.{{Cite news |last=Sun |first=Eryn |date=December 27, 2011 |title=Former American Idol Finalist Danny Gokey Engaged |work=The Christian Post |url=http://www.christianpost.com/news/former-american-idol-finalist-danny-gokey-engaged-65853/ |access-date=October 16, 2015}} He is the fifth of six children. He has a brother named Charles, and four sisters: Angela, Janell, Gina, and Tracey.{{cite web |title=Danny Gokey Biography |url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/danny-gokey/bio/296849 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090402053504/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/danny-gokey/bio/296849 |archive-date=April 2, 2009 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=TV Guide}}{{Cite news |last=Wiggins |first=Leslie Anne |title=American Idol Top 36: Danny Gokey |publisher=WITI-TV Fox 6 |url=http://www.fox6now.com/entertainment/sns-american_idol-top_36-danny_gokey,0,3775152.story |access-date=October 16, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110711022423/http://www.fox6now.com/entertainment/sns-american_idol-top_36-danny_gokey%2C0%2C3775152.story |archive-date=July 11, 2011}} He has acknowledged the influence of Jeffrey and Robin Pruitt, who are the pastors of the church where he worked, and also Matthew Barnett, the founder of the LA Dream Center. He has stated that his faith is the "key to who I am".[http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39823267.html "Milwaukee's Gokey wows judges, makes 'Idol' finals"] Tim Cuprisin, Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, February 18, 2009. Archivied from [https://web.archive.org/web/20090221131515/http://www.jsonline.com/entertainment/tvradio/39823267.html the original] on February 21, 2009. Retrieved January 18, 2022. Gokey was a church music director, while also driving a semi truck for a local logistics company for two years. ==''American Idol''== [[File:Danny Gokey.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Gokey in his hometown of Milwaukee, Wisconsin in 2009]] ===Overview=== Gokey rose to national fame with his participation in the eighth season of ''American Idol''. Gokey's ''American Idol'' audition occurred only four weeks after his wife's death in July 2008.{{cite web |date=January 14, 2009 |title=Danny Gokey — "I Heard It Through The Grapevine" Audition — American Idol 8 |url=http://www.rickey.org/?p=11026 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120907214504/http://www.rickey.org/?p=11026 |archive-date=September 7, 2012 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=Rickey}} He auditioned with his friend Jamar Rogers, who also made it through to Hollywood but was eliminated before the live shows. During Rock Week (Top 4 week), Gokey's take on [[Aerosmith]]'s "[[Dream On (Aerosmith song)|Dream On]]" was planned for the extended scream with which he finished the song.{{cite web |last=Cantiello |first=Jim |date=May 7, 2009 |title='American Idol' Rock Week Makes Us Scream On Like Danny Gokey |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1610808/20090507/story.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090510132131/https://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1610808/20090507/story.jhtml |archive-date=May 10, 2009 |access-date=October 16, 2015 |website=MTV}} Gokey was the only contestant in that season who was never in the bottom two or three, but he was eliminated in third place on May 13, 2009, after his performance of [[Joe Cocker]]'s "[[You Are So Beautiful]]".{{Cite news |date=May 14, 2009 |title=American Idol 8: Final 2 results show eliminates Danny Gokey |work=NJ |url=https://www.nj.com/entertainment/tv/2009/05/american_idol_8_final_2_result.html |access-date=September 12, 2023}} During the season 8 finale on May 20, 2009, Gokey performed a duet with [[rhythm and blues]] singer-songwriter [[Lionel Richie]].
